channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16598] Enable zookeeper useMulti always and clean up in HBase code
item.description:
We have zookeeper useMulti default true since HBase 1.0.0
And in our Doc, "ZooKeeper 3.4.x is required as of HBase 1.0.0"
The benefit of useMulti is obvious.
Let's clean up the code to remove useMulti false case so that we don't have to continue with the hassle of maintaining two version of the code (e.g. in replication) . No go back to pre 3.4.x Zookeeper.
item.summary: Enable zookeeper useMulti always and clean up in HBase code

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
this does not seem to compile, since we removed ZOOKEEPER_USEMULTI from HConstants.java


   public static void multiOrSequential(ZooKeeperWatcher zkw, List<ZKUtilOp> ops,

       boolean runSequentialOnMultiFailure) throws KeeperException {

+    if (zkw.getConfiguration().get(HConstants.ZOOKEEPER_USEMULTI) != null) {

+      LOG.warn(HConstants.ZOOKEEPER_USEMULTI + " is deprecated. Default to true always.");

+    }

but other than that, patch looks great

Thanks, Matteo.
Removing HConstants.ZOOKEEPER_USEMULTI was the last touch in the my iterations. My bad.
Attached v2.

-1 overall

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Deprecate the configuration property 'hbase.zookeeper.useMulti'.
useMulti will always be enabled. ZooKeeper 3.4.x and newer is required.

Internal:

The ZKUtil#multiOrSequential(ZooKeeperWatcher zkw, List<ZKUtilOp> ops, boolean runSequentialOnMultiFailure) will not check 'hbase.zookeeper.useMulti' anymore, and will always use multi.
It can still fall back to sequential operations if:

RunSequentialOnMultiFailure is true
On calling multi, we get a ZooKeeper exception that can be handled by a sequential call.
